instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air 2017 water damage
threads.message:
hi again, I have this board with water damage.

I check short but I can find this

Without battery when connect charger I have led green after orange..

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=0v 

any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air 2017 water damage
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

Which areas have been affected by liquid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air 2017 water damage
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 16.5 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4 V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.6 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3,30 V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 0 V

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>

Pin 1 0v
Pin 2 16,50v
Pin 3 0v
Pin 9 0v
Pin 12 0v
Pin 13 0v
Pin 14 0v
Pin 15 0v
Pin 17 0v
Pin 19 5v
Pin 20 5v
Pin 27 16v

liquid at back all logic board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air 2017 water damage
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.6 V"
This implies <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is good; why don't you get 3V at pin 13?
Check <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR>.

"<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4 V"
Why don't you get 3.4V at pin 12V?
Check the trace.

"Pin 3 0v"
Fix ACIN problem too; check <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air 2017 water damage
threads.message: Check <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> I don't have value only continuity and <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> = 480ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air 2017 water damage
threads.message:
If <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> is 0 ohm, why don't you get 3V at pin 13???

<RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> is 130K resistor.
It will measure lower onboard, but far of 480 ohm.
Post diode mode to ground at pin 3.

Please, try to understand a schematic!
